title: Job Vacancies at Lafarge Africa Plc
content:
Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group – the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Mechanical Manager

Requisition ID: 14041
Job Location: Ewekoro, Ogun
Job type: Full-time

About the Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure completion of mechanical maintenance jobs with the highest level of quality, safety and effectiveness at minimum cost to maximise equipment availability. 
	Apply preventive and predictive maintenance practices, and contribute to their improvement.


What you'll be doing 


	Communicate clearly on information relating to potentially dangerous situations and get confirmation that they are correctly understood.
	Make sure that key equipment is working properly.
	Ensure the use of Personal Protective Equipment.
	Is responsible for the execution and the quality of maintenance work to be carried out on mechanical equipment according to planned work orders.
	Responsible for knowledge transfer and develop team members for improve performance.
	Ensure proper day-to-day scheduling of works and necessary resources. Assign and review work to perform with the craftsmen.
	Ensure, upon completion of repairs, that equipment is in good operating condition, ready to meet operational requirements, fully inspected, tested, clean and safe.
	Ensure and control quality of maintenance jobs done by subcontractors.
	Provide reporting on repair jobs including consumption of materials, specific tools, man-hours and skills, and fills equipment history files.
	Ensure completion of major operations within schedule (yearly overhaul).
	Contribute in his field, to the development of working methods and definition of procedures and ensure their implementation.
	Keep him/herself informed of general plant practices so as to ensure “on-call” duty.
	Contribute to Root Cause Analysis.
	Participate in the Plant Improvement Plan (PIP).
	Check for safety and cleanness in the workplace


Who you'll be working with:


	Direct Reports
	
		Mechanical Engineers
		Workshop Team
		Mechanical Supervisors.
		Craftsmen.
	
	


What we are looking for


	Minimum 5 years of postgraduate experience in execution (Mechanical)
	Proficiency in the use of maintenance tools like SAP etc.
	Good knowledge of cement manufacturing processes.
	Good knowledge of safety laws and regulations.
	Good written and verbal communications skills
	Good knowledge of Reliability based maintenance practices.
	Good problem solving skills through the root cause failure analysis.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Process Engineer

Requisition ID: 12834
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River
Job type: Full-time

Description 


	The Process Engineer leads plant discussions and investigations to improve throughput, efficiency, quality, and environmental performance.
	Through data analysis, field measurements, and conversations with employees are able to diagnose issues and develop solutions to move the plant towards greater performance.


Responsibilities
What you'll be Doing:


	Makes positive contributions to the plant safety activities and initiatives.
	Provides technical support to the plant’s production, quality, and environmental functions. Understands strategies, priorities, and optimization techniques that assist the plant in attainment of plant and company objectives.
	Conduct inspections, measurements and operational assessment for shop assigned to you.
	Follow-up actions / recommendations from findings with the responsible
	Daily evaluates operations, processes, and trends through the use of audits and systematic approach, for example RCAs, Incidence assessment & reporting etc.
	Provides technical support on implementation of new equipment and/or new procedures including training of plant personnel as required. Serves as mentor to CCR Operators in production and other departments.
	This position has a requirement of elevating the technical knowledge and practices of all facets of the operation.
	Ensure compliance with internal control procedures - communicating problems in operations, unwarranted deviations from established standards, and violations of policy or law.
	Primary to the Process Engineer position is the coordination and participation in improvement of the Plant’s technical capabilities.
	The Process Engineer’s objectives are to initiate process optimization in collaboration with Quality, Production and Maintenance to ensure maximum and efficient utilization of the plant’s equipment.
	Initiate actions for de-bottlenecking equipment and Processes and engage with stakeholders to close the actions.
	Design and contribute development of new systems, equipment and procedures and propose modifications of existing ones for continuous process improvement. Include economic and operational feasibility studies. Support commissioning and de-bottleneck new installations
	Promote the increased use of AFR (if applicable): provide comprehensive technical expertise to evaluate AFR with respect to its impact on the process; develop and implement solutions to eliminate / reduce impact of AFR on the process operation
	Ensure involvement in the implementation and maintenance of an Integrated management system (IMS) in the plant.


Who You'll Be Working With
Internal:


	Kiln coach, control room supervisors, production supervisor, coordinators, shift chemist and managers, corporate engineers.
	Quality, Production, Maintenance, Environment Departments


External:
List of Direct Reports:


	Process technicians, Industrial trainees/interns


Requirements
What we are Looking for:


	Candidates should possess a Degree in Chemical / Process Engineering 
	5 years of working experience with at least 3 years in cement Industry.
	Good knowledge of cement manufacturing Process
	Perform the measurements of a basic process: gas flow measurement, false air mapping etc.
	Organize and perform an audit to any one area of a plant: Equipment/gas / thermal/ material balance of a kiln or a mill based on a pre-established model.
	Audit reporting 
	Tune a control loop.
	Understand the strategy of an expert system. (HLC)
	Good knowledge of statistical process control methods.
	Good knowledge of project management methods.
	Strong computer expertise in but not limited to: Excel,
	Good knowledge of SAP, TIS, and PACT.


OH&S Competencies:


	Implements OH&S Mission: Ensures alignment of OH&S activities arising from the country OH&S mission.
	Ensures adequate OH&S organization: Ensures relevant actions are taken so that OH&S requirements are met
	Identifies Hazards & Control Risks: Actively manages risks by ensuring that all related control activities are implemented thoroughly


Behavioral competence:


	Ability to work effectively under time pressure, in a demanding environment, while maintaining the highest professional standards. Ability to self-organize, prioritize tasks, take initiatives, and make recommendations while engaging with Senior Leaders.
	Intellectual curiosity and strategic thinking; eagerness to learn, excellent analytical skills, Objective focus, Courage and integrity Intellectual humility, Honesty, Respect.


Leadership and managerial abilities:


	Communication skills (verbally /on paper), teaching ability, listening skills, team spirit,
	Adapting to change and creativity.


Mobility requirements:


	Ability to work in multi-national environment, Readiness to travel, Flexibility.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Security Operative

Requisition ID: 10385
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Security Operative (SO) is responsible for keeping Lafarge Africa and suppliers’ staff, visitors, and similar safe & secure.
	Based on shift work rotation the SO will be in the plant between eight and twelve hours, also on weekends, and supervise all security related activities while in parallel supervise and support all company transport activities.


What you'll be doing


	Responsible for the protection of the company’s PEARL (People, Environment, Assets, Reputation & Legal Exposure) in the South-East Region under the direction of the Security Manager South-East.
	Support the supervision of the Private Security Provider, ensuring they fulfil their contractual obligations. Conduct supervisory checks on the 3rd party security provider and the services provided such as random checks at guard locations in Mfamosing Plant (MFA) and Calabar, joining vehicular patrols and ensuring all standards agreed are being fulfilled. To be conducted utilising various online tools that are available.
	Ensure Lafarge Health & Safety standards are adhered to.
	Supervise and direct the armed security incident response force.
	Supervise and direct security assets during crises periods and/or in case of direct assaults on company staff and/or assets.
	Provide reliable and concise incident data and write accurate reports via the various company online tools.
	Interact with the local PSF (Public Security Forces) in cases of (armed) attacks, intrusions, trespassing, fraud and theft.
	Safeguard that all Security & Resilience Policies of the company are adhered to.
	Act as a communicator between the Plant Management and Security Department when the Senior Security Operatives is not present.
	Work in shifts ensuring there is a 24/7 security supervision function on duty.
	Support with investigations and detailed report writing. Validate reporting independent of the Private Security Provider’s report.
	 Conduct independent assessments and identify gaps in baseline physical security and notify/ advise both the Security Manager and Senior Security Operative.
	Gather local intelligence on all aspects and issues to support and protect the business.
	Create and maintain intelligence networks.
	Reporting of incidents on the Group Security SINT platform.
	Monitoring and supervision of CCTV operators, video evidence assessment and ongoing projects.


What we are looking for


	OND minimum requirement 
	A minimum of 4 years of experience in a security supervisory position
	Security incident supervisory experience (incl. following up on complex incidents such as shootings, armed attacks, theft, and similar)
	Experience of supervising teams and resources
	Capability to drive Lafarge security standards in all business activities.
	Be Microsoft Office proficient
	Ability to produce different kind of vetted and accurate incident reports.


Who you'll be working with:


	Senior Security Operative
	Contractors 
	All levels of staff.


Click here to apply online

title: Job Openings at Human Capital Partners
content:
Human Capital Partners is a professional services firm that specializes in the provision of management consulting services covering the entire human resource management value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT Graduate Trainee (ICT Officer)

Job Locations: Delta and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A leading oil and gas company is seeking a highly motivated and skilled IT Graduate Trainee (ICT Officer) to join its ICT team.
	This role plays a critical part in supporting and maintaining the company’s ICT infrastructure and will serve as the first line of support for networks, servers, and other essential IT services.


Responsibilities


	Support the procurement, installation, maintenance, and upgrades of network and telecom hardware, software, and systems.
	Assist in configuring and testing new ICT equipment and applications.
	Coordinate with vendors on software implementation and license management.
	Manage network user profiles, printer servers, and related infrastructure.
	Provide first-line support for network and telecom issues.
	Support system backups, security updates, and hardware/software inventory tracking.
	Assist end users with ICT issues, including installations, troubleshooting, and relocations.
	Contribute to user awareness initiatives and maintain the ICT ServiceDesk logs and documentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in IT-related field such as Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, MIS, etc., OR 1-3 years of IT working experience with a bachelor’s degree in any other field.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience with IT systems and tools.
	Relevant IT Certifications such as ITIL, COBIT, MCSE, Cisco Certifications, A+, CISA are a plus.
	Knowledge of network/system security and VOIP technologies.
	Attention to detail andcommitment to accuracy
	Experienced in incident and problem management.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and customer service skills.
	Time management, prioritization, and analytical thinking.
	Self-motivated, able to multitask effectively and perform under pressure.


Application Closing Date: 28th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ibrahim.ogunleye@hcp-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Chief Operating Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary


	As part of on-going initiatives to strengthen its operations and enhance its capacity to achieve its goals, our client seeks to recruit a dynamic, exceptional and results-oriented professional to fill the position of Chief Operating Officer.
	Reporting to the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, the successful candidate will be responsible for directing and coordinating the internal operational activities of the Organisation that ensure achievement of its lending and profitability goals. 
	The overarching objective of the role is client relationship management and operational efficiency encompassing business development, client acquisition, credit appraisal and structuring.


Responsibilities
Other responsibilities will include the following:


	Provide leadership for the business development, product development and credit operations teams in the execution of the Organisation's activities.
	Oversee the articulation and development of a strategic business development and relationship management framework.
	Develop and maintain strategic relationships with various stakeholders, including key institutions and strategic business alliances.
	Champion a customer management framework to build and maintain strong relationships with clients for business growth and retention.
	Coordinate the development and review of strategies for product management and customer acquisition for the short, medium and long term.
	Develop strategic partnerships to enhance end-user needs assessment and position the Organisation before its target audience.
	Drive the credit assessment process and ensure all credit requests meet the eligibility criteria as set out in the credit policy.
	Monitor and report on the performance of all products, schemes and investments managed by the Organisation.


Qualifications, Experience and Attributes


	A Bachelor's Degree in any discipline, combined with a master's degree in a business-related discipline.
	Relevant business-related professional certification(s).
	A minimum of eighteen (18) years' cognate experience, with at least thirteen (13) years in the Banking industry and at least five (5) years in a top management role in MSME and commercial business.
	Proven experience in several areas of banking operations including business development, portfolio management and customer service management.
	Demonstrable knowledge of risk management, proficiency in credit analysis and appraisal, and loan administration.
	Proven leadership, negotiating and influencing skills.
	Strong understanding of banking operations as well as applicable industry regulations.
	Good working knowledge of financial procedures and applications.
	Strong business and financial acumen.
	Excellent strategic networking, interpersonal and relationship management skills.
	Maturity and tact, including the ability to relate with different internal and external stakeholders.
	Well-honed skills to persuade, influence, as well as manage and sustain effective relationships.
	High ethical standards and integrity.


Application Closing Date: 3rd June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their current Curriculum Vitae (prepared as a Microsoft Word document, and saved with their full names) to: recruitment@hcp-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	All applications and information provided will be held in strict confidence.
	Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.


 

 

3.) Production Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are recruiting Production Officers to support daily water treatment and production operations at various locations across Lagos.
	The role involves working in a technical and process-driven environment to ensure the efficient production and delivery of potable water.
	Ideal candidates are detail-oriented, safety-conscious, and eager to grow within a critical public service sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor water treatment systems and equipment (pumps, valves, filters, etc.)
	Record and report operational parameters such as flow rate, pressure, water levels, and chemical dosing
	Maintain clean and organized workspaces within the production plant
	Participate in scheduled maintenance and collaborate with engineering teams when required
	Carry out routine checks and inspections on plant facilities and assist in basic troubleshooting
	Ensure compliance with operational procedures, safety protocols, and environmental regulations
	Support shift operations, including weekends and public holidays, as part of a rotation schedule
	Escalate faults or abnormalities promptly to supervisors or technical teams.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related Engineering field
	Good understanding of basic mechanical or electrical operations
	Willingness to work in a physically demanding and shift-based environment
	Strong observational and reporting skills
	Ability to follow instructions, adhere to protocols, and maintain safety standards
	Prior industrial training or internship in utility, manufacturing, or process industry is an added advantage.


Application Closing Date: 24th July, 2025.

title: Customer Service & Social Media Representative Job at Solutions Consultancy
content:
The Solutions Consultancy - Our client, a growing lifestyle retail brand, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service & Social Media Representative

Job Location: Kado, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Days: Monday – Saturday
Time: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is seeking to hire a Customer Service & Social Media Representative. This is a full-time, in-store role for smart and dedicated individuals who are passionate about retail, customer experience, and social media.
	We are looking for fresh graduates (BSc, HND, OND) who are eager to gain hands-on experience in a fast-growingretail environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Attend to walk-in customers and online inquiries via WhatsApp, phone, and email
	Manage daily customer service needs across all channels
	Schedule and publish basic content on social media platforms
	Engage with customers online and respond to comments or messages
	Coordinate with vendors to confirm stock availability, deliveries, and restocking
	Assist with basic eCommerce operations, including processing and tracking orders


Requirements


	A minimum of OND, HND, or BSc in any field
	Must reside in or around Kado, Abuja (applicants living far from the location will not be considered)
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Familiarity with Instagram, WhatsApp Business, and basic social media tools
	Basic knowledge of eCommerce and online retail customer behavior
	Detail-oriented, organized, and customer-focused
	Willingness to work in a fast-paced retail setting.


Salary
N50,000 - N70,000 per month (includes transport and data stipend). 

 

Note: Only serious applicants who meet the location and qualification criteria will be contacted.

title: Job Vacancies at Insight Tours and Travels Limited
content:
Insight Tours and Travels Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

1.) Travel Consultant (Reservations & Ticketing)

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The ideal candidate will be an experienced travel consultant who has great passion for travel and tourism.
	The person must be apt at booking travel arrangements which includes flight, hotel accommodation, tours, excursions/activities and visa applications for clients (individuals, families, groups, or corporates).


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Create flight reservations, ticketing, cancellations, refund and after sales services
	Organize end-end trips services.
	Research various destinations and means of travel and advise customers regarding visa processing requirements, flight fares, customs, weather conditions, check-in formalities, etc.
	Resolve challenges relating to customers’ trips, complaints, or refund, etc.
	Attend travel seminars to remain updated with travel and tourism trends.
	Diagnose clients’ travel needs and suggest suitable travel packages or services.
	Handle unforeseen problems, complaints and determine the right course of action.
	Create and update electronic records of clients, securely.
	Maintain a good relationship with customers.
	Negotiate any customizations or modifications requested by clients and accommodate them to the very best possible degree.


Requirements


	 BSc or HND in any discipline with a minimum of Second class Lower (2:2).
	Experience: 1-year of  proven work experience as a Travel and Tours Consultant
	GDS experience – Galileo is compulsory. Amadeus, and Sabre will be an added advantage.
	Possess good contact base with travel agencies and tour companies (Local and International).
	Sales skills and customer-oriented approach.
	Experienced in various areas of travel (domestic/international, business/holidays, group/individual, etc.)
	Proficiency in MS Office and knowledge of operating standard office equipment.
	Excellent verbal communication, presentation, negotiation, command of English and management skills.
	Good writing skills for drafting cover letters and emails
	Excellent Research & Feedback skills.
	Excellent use of initiative and proactive approach in delivering tasks.
	Problem-solving attitude.
	A customer-oriented attitude.
	Ability to work well with a team.
	Effective coordination skills.
	Passion to Learn and Grow.


Application Closing Date: 30th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: insighttourshr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 


2.) Visa and International School Admission Processing Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time, On-site

Job Summary


	We are in need of a visa, overseas school admission processing, and immigration consultant to manage the end-to-end of visa and interactions with prospective and existing clients.
	To also support management with daily operational tasks, in alignment with executing overall strategy for the business operations unit.


Requirements


	Prior and Good knowledge of Tourist, Business, Student, Medical Visa processing and Overseas schools Admission processing to Canada, USA, UK, South Africa, Dubai, Australia, New Zealand, Schengen & European countries, African Countries and other destinations.
	Education/Certifications: BSc in Business Administration, International Relations, Social Sciences or any related discipline with a minimum of Second class Lower (2:2).
	Experience: 2 years’ work experience in related field.
	Possess good contact base with other visa assistance professionals, travel agencies and tour companies (Local and International).
	Proficiency in MS Office and knowledge of operating standard office equipment.
	Excellent verbal communication, presentation, negotiation, command of English and management skills.
	Excellent Research & Feedback skills.
	Excellent use of initiative and proactive approach in delivering tasks.
	Problem-solving attitude.
	A customer-oriented attitude.
	Ability to work well with a team.
	Effective coordination skills.
	Passion to Learn and Grow


Responsibilities


	Manage the end-to-end process of visa application. Successfully fill & process Tourist, Business, Student, Medical visa applications and insurance.
	Handle Admission processing into Colleges/Universities Abroad. Advise potential students on education opportunities overseas, explain about colleges/universities, courses and their options.
	Ensure clients submit all the required documents and information needed for processing their admissions and applications. Follow Up for additional documents required.
	Building and maintaining relationships with clients and key stakeholders within the Organization.
	Oversee coaching, mock interviews and advisory services to clients in preparation for application appointments.
	Ensure timely submission and collection of client visa applications.
	Proactively update/ advise registered clients on evolving Immigration laws and processes.
	Ensure that all organization's policies are followed in both written and verbal relations with Clients.
	Continually research and be abreast of different Countries’ Visa Application process and requirements.
	Assist Sales, Product Development, Research and Social Media Unit with information and professional advice when required.
	Direct potential leads to the sales team and follow up on progress.
	Continually Inform Clients about other services the Organization offers.
	Establish working relationship with different embassies in order to have updated information and special treatment of visa applications.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly (Negotiable).

Application Closing Date: 24th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: insighttourshr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Sales & Business Development Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full time, On-site
Company: Insight Tours and Travels Limited

Summary


	The ideal candidate will be a high performing, self-driven, and result-oriented sales professional who understands the sales process for new customer acquisition and revenue growth and is responsible for the success of the company’s sales department.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maximizing our sales team potential, crafting sales plans and justifying those plans to the management and must have strong communication skills and have a proven/positive track record of exceeding outlined goals.


Responsibilities


	Generate new business opportunities and develop sales outlets to drive revenue growth and profit margins.
	Prospect, sign up new corporate accounts and ensurethey are functional and productive.
	Manage current & new accounts to ensure each grows by revenue and profit margin.
	Meet and exceed weekly and monthly revenue and profit margin targets
	Identify advantages and compare Insight Tours and Travels’ products/services with competitors.
	Develop, plan and monitor sales strategy plan formaximizing company's Return on Investment at all times.
	Ensure prompt payment for our products & services and recover debts from clientele when necessary.
	Recruit and manage affiliates, freelancers and subagent portfolios to increase in sales generation, revenue and profit margin.
	Ensure client's retention with Insight Tours and TravelsLimited through customer relationship management, customer care, service and support delivery.
	Develop clear and effective written proposals for current and prospective customers.
	Develop and submit weekly reports to the management on sales, revenue team activities, customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.
	Analyze the market's potential and determine the value of existing and prospective customer's value to the organization.
	Participate in sales presentation to describe account management process and assist in bid process for preferred vendor when requested.
	Manage sales budgets
	Attend sales meetings, events and conferences for networking and to keep abreast of the latest developments.
	Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends.


Requirements


	Degree in Management, Business Studies, or related field
	Two (2) years of proven work experience as a Sales Representative, Travel Consultant and Agency Management.
	Highly motivated, vibrant, productive, result oriented and target driven with a proven track record in sales and agency management
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
	Relationship management, leadership and organizational skills and openness to feedback.
	Thorough understanding of diverse business processes and strategy development
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office, databases, and information systems.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to: insighttourshr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
